item.title: City fight back to end Anfield hoodoo
item.description:
Erling Haaland's stoppage-time penalty earned Manchester City a dramatic 2-1 win at Liverpool on Sunday to reduce Arsenal's lead at the top of the Premier League back to six points.

item.description: A government-to-government contract for the purchase of hydrographic and oceanographic survey ship ‘HMS Enterprise’ was signed between Bangladesh and the United Kingdom at the Bangladesh Navy headquarters in Dhaka on Sunday....Bangladesh cultural tours

item.title: Govt withdraws 23,865 political cases
item.description: The interim government has withdrawn 23,865 false and politically motivated cases filed by the previous Awami League government against leaders and activists of various political parties, including BNP, Jamaat-e-Islami and Hefazat-e-Islam....

item.title: Kamindu heroics steer Sri Lanka past Ireland in T20 World Cup
item.description:
Sri Lanka's 11th-hour call to draft in Kamindu Mendis proved a masterstroke as the all-rounder produced a match turning cameo to set up a 20-run win over Ireland in their T20 World Cup opener at Colombo’s R. Premadasa Stadium on Sunday.

item.description: National Citizen Party convener Nahid Islam, in a televised address Sunday evening, outlined a sweeping reform agenda emphasising social justice, economic fairness and accountable governance while sharply criticizing past governments for discrimination and neglect....

item.description: Bangladesh Jamaat-e-Islami amir Shafiqur Rahman on Sunday said that they would act as guardians of the people’s lives, wealth and dignity, declaring they would serve the nation rather than rule it....

item.title: CGS survey: 50pc minority voters worry about security
item.description: More than 50 per cent of the minority communities are concerned about security ahead of the 13th Jatiya Sangsad elections, while over 25 per cent consider the voting process unsafe or extremely unsafe, according to a survey by the Centre for Governance Studies....

item.description: Bangladesh eyes further cut in the rate of United States-imposed reciprocal tariff as the country is set to sign a deal with the US today in Washington amid purchasing more US goods....

item.title: Govt under fire for hasty, hazy foreign deals
item.description: The interim government led by Nobel laureate Professor Muhammad Yunus has been signing agreements and memorandums of understanding one after another with foreign countries even at the fag end of its tenure amid widespread criticisms from important quarters......

item.title: Why human factors engineering matters
item.description: Human Factors Engineering, also known as ergonomics, is the scientific study of how humans interact with systems. It draws on psychology, engineering, design and organisational studies to enhance safety, efficiency and well-being, ensuring that tools, technologies and workplaces align with human abilities and limitations......

item.title: Can manifesto deliver long-awaited change?
item.description: ELECTION season in Bangladesh is always a time of hope, expectation and promise. The manifestos roll out with fanfare, each one more grandiose than the last, as political parties strive to offer a better future to the people. Yet, more often than not, these promises remain nothing more than a distant dream. They are like clouds on the horizon, always promising rain but......

item.title: When diplomacy meets ballot box
item.description: WHENEVER a new US ambassador arrives in Dhaka, a familiar cycle begins. Optimism appears in some quarters. Suspicion hardens in others. Expectations, often exaggerated, are projected onto one individual. Yet ambassadors are never just individuals. They arrive carrying the weight of their country’s foreign policy, shaped by history, geopolitics and the local......

item.title: Wetlands are treasure islands
item.description: BANGLADESH is a delta, crisscrossed by an intricate network of rivers, haors, baors, lakes, beels, mangrove and swamp forests, ponds, dighis, estuaries, and floodplains. Our wetlands are not static backwaters; they are dynamic ecosystems that sustain life in ways both visible and unseen. According to the Ramsar Convention, nearly two-thirds of Bangladesh is classified as......

item.title: Ballot authentication can stem tempering with voting
item.description: WITH three days to go before the national elections for a democratic transition after years of disenfranchisement, it is imperative that the vote be conducted without electoral fraud. In this context, the concerns that the Bangladesh Nationalist Party raised on February 7 that a political party was planning on ways for election manipulation need serious consideration. The......Bangladesh cultural tours

item.title: Candidate’s tax secrecy clouds election accountability
item.description: MORE than a third of the 2,026 candidates contesting the forthcoming national elections, scheduled for February 12, have not made their income tax records public when they filed their nomination, as Citizens for Good Governance reported on February 7. The electoral legislation makes it mandatory that the candidates submit the proof of filing income tax returns. The......
